data_findings.finding: Current best score: 70.676102, Target: 68.919154, Gap: 1.76 points (2.5%). Pre-optimized santa-2025.csv is at a tight local optimum. Standard SA optimization found NO improvements. Backward propagation found NO improvements. Ensemble doesn't help because santa-2025.csv dominates all N values.

Key insight from discussions: Asymmetric solutions outperform symmetric ones. New N=22 asymmetric config achieves <0.36 normalized area. Lattice/grid-based approach for large N (N>=58) is recommended but NOT YET TRIED. Small N values (1-10) have lowest efficiency and highest score contribution - N=1 contributes 0.66 to total score.

bbox3.cpp is the main optimizer used in top kernels. It uses: Complex number vector coordination, Fluid dynamics, Hinge pivot, Density gradient flow, Global boundary tension. Key parameters: -n (iterations), -r (rounds). The optimizer uses simulated annealing with aggressive overlap repair.

Tree geometry: 15 vertices (NV=15). Base coordinates TX/TY define the Christmas tree shape. Trunk width 0.15, trunk height 0.2, base width 0.7, mid width 0.4, top width 0.25, tip at y=0.8. Trees can be rotated and translated.
